title: Discovery
text:
This report documents a series of prompts with ChatGPT to learn more about the project. Here is the version I’m using:
OpenAI. (2024). ChatGPT (February 2024 version) [Large language model]. Retrieved from https://openai.com/chatgpt
Below is my first prompt. You can copy/paste this into chatGPT.
Scroll you mouse over the text box to get a “copy to clipboard” icon in the top right of the text box.
To create a menu-driven application that allows colleagues to select AWS virtual machines based on predefined sizes (e.g., small, medium, large), you can follow this structured approach:
Here is my second prompt. Again, you can cut/paste this into your copy of ChatGPT.
No, AWS Free Tier does not cover t3.small, t3.medium, or t3.large instances. However, you can use t2.micro or t3.micro for free under the AWS Free Tier.

title: Discovery
text:
Summary
In the prompts below I asked ChatGPT to provide a framework for creating a service catalog where a user can select the power/size of a virtual machine from a menu.
ChatGPT provided several options. These looked pricey so I asked if there were options that could live within the free tier.
Response: YES, there are several EC2 instances (t2.micro and t3.micro) that are available to the free tier.
Because your developing a proof-of-concept, I suggest that you focus your development on the framework/service catalog stubbing out your various VM options using t2.micro and t3.micro. This will minimize resource costs, and once your ready for production testing, you can swap to larger, more realistic, and more pricey options.

title: Home
text:
This project website is creating using Quarto and GitHub Pages
The project repository is here: https://github.com/vcu-ssg/ssg-aws-vm-picker

title: Home
text:
Documents
This site only contains one document. Additional documents can be added later.
Discovery is the only document on the site so far. This document presents the concept for the application and walks through a series of ChatGPT learning how the application might be implementing using AWS resources.
